title: Ticket #7002: Fix ClassAds lexer to not read unneeded characters
description:
The ClassAds lexer always reads one character beyond the last token consumed, even though it often doesn't need to. It frequently pushes these characters back into the input source, then usually re-consumes them when the next token is requested. When a ClassAd is parsed, the character after the end of the ad is pushed back but not re-consumed before the parse method returns.

We'd like to avoid pushing back characters when possible, especially when it happens on the return of a successful parse. Here are two concrete problems that can result:

  • When a FILE is open in text mode, the file position is undefined until a pushed-back character is re-consumed.

  • In the Python 3 bindings, each parse call creates a temporary FILE around the file descriptor obtained from Python. If a parse operation finishes with a character pushed back into the stream via ungetc(), it will be lost in subsequent I/O, including another parse call. In particular, if a stream contains two ClassAds with no intervening whitespace, parsing the second one will fail: 
    [ A=3 ][ B=true ]
